metadata.title: CVE-2018-5102 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when manipulating HTML mediaelements with media streams, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.6, Firefox ESR < 52.6, andFirefox < 58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5102` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required
